subject: Art & Design
title: The Auteur Theory: Director as Author
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Auteur Theory: Director as Author.

hook.text: You can tell a Wes Anderson film in 3 seconds: centered frames, pastel palettes, deadpan delivery.

buildup.text: Auteur theory argues that the director is the primary creative author of a film, like a novelist of a book.

discovery.text: French critic AndrÃ© Bazin and the Cahiers du cinÃ©ma group championed this idea in the 1950s.

twist.text: Critics argue filmmaking is collaborative. Editors, cinematographers, and writers shape films equally.

climax.text: Despite debate, auteur-driven films often have the strongest artistic identity: Kubrick, Lynch, Villeneuve.

punchline.text: An auteur doesn't just make films. They make a world.
